posts.cooked:
When backing up, has it been discussed to have an option to, for example, only include audio and text, but exclude images and videos?

Thanks

I know a post that starts with ‚ÄúOption to‚Ä¶‚Äù may not have a good chance but I will ask anyway.

I‚Äôve noticed that all media are included in the single backup file that Signal creates. As a user makes Signal their main messenger, sending and receiving lots of photos etc with multiple contacts, the backup file size shoots through the roof.

It would be very useful to have the option not to include media in the backup. For user models where we will send confidential information that we want to keep via text but we will almost always only send silly daily-life photos that are not important to keep, this option will help keep the backup size low.

Thoughts?

I agree, and offered something similar here to be able to choose, say, audio and text, but ignore video, images, and documents

Option to exclude specific media types from backup? Android Feature Requests
When backing up, has it been discussed to have an option to, for example, only include audio and text, but exclude images and videos? Thanks

This could be really useful when you want to keep your message history but aren‚Äôt interested in the attached media. To prevent confusion the media thumbnail could be kept so the user can see what the message was referring to.

Yes, that would be a great option!

This is precisely why I use Signal only for text chats - and send ALL my photos, pictures, videos, voice messages and other media via WhatsApp. VERY INCONVENIENT, but unavoidable!

WhatsApp does a much better job separating the text per se from all the media. They are stored separately, they can be copies / backed up separately, they can be deleted separately.

Also, WhatsApp seems to compress images WAY LESS than Signal does! I still don‚Äôt understand this weird behavior on the part of Signal devs in 2018 (soon to be 2019!)‚Ä¶ I mean, surely every mobile OS, phone, data channel can by now handle uncompressed images! This is not 1998.

AKayumov:

they can be deleted separately

This is something I‚Äôd really love to be able to do with Signal. But this is apparently a ‚Äúdesign decision‚Äù of OWS that needs discussion. Once I created a topic regarding this: Media deletion: Keep message text / don't delete whole message

link_counts.title: Media deletion: Keep message text / don't delete whole message

posts.name: Vishwa
posts.cooked:
It would be really helpful if there is an option to backup only text messages excluding photos and videos.

Currently, my backup file is whopping 2.7GB in size. Every time I click Backup, It creates another 2.7GB file on my device. Most of the size comes from videos and photos which I don‚Äôt really want.

A text only backup would significantly decrease the size of the backup file. A smaller backup file is always better. People can even sync the backup folder with cloud storage services like Next Cloud/Dropbox/Google Drive which would make it really useful.

Also, it is a well known bug that Signal crashes while restoring huge backups (on some devices). Today, I couldn‚Äôt restore my 2.7GB file. The app just closes. I managed to restore one of my old 1.4GB file. Lost all the recent conversations.

PS: WhatsApp has this feature.

posts.name: Johanw666
posts.cooked:
As far as I know WhatsApp lets you export its messages in plain text but not import them. If you have rot there are options to export it in nice html.

For Signal, such an export exists but unfortunately only in forks.

posts.name: Vishwa
posts.cooked:
johanw666:

As far as I know WhatsApp lets you export its messages in plain text but not import them. If you have rot there are options to export it in nice html.

For Signal, such an export exists but unfortunately only in forks.

Yes. You are right. While importing, it first imports all the texts and makes the app usable. It later restores the media messages in background. An elegant solution.

Hi!

I think it would be useful if I could exclude media from the daily automatic backups. I really don‚Äôt care for saving all the memes and random images I receive.

Of course, this should be an option. I‚Äôm sure there are plenty of people who would like to include media in their backups.

Yes, this feature would be very helpful.

Media deletion: Keep message text / don't delete whole message Feature Requests
Hi folks, as Greyson Parrelli (from the Signal Team) stated in a GitHub comment, deleting [‚Ä¶] media (via the media viewer, or ‚Äúall media‚Äù screen) will also delete the message itself. Well, I can confirm this, but that was not what (I guess) someone is expecting when you‚Äôre going to delete media, since the media technically (and IMHO logically as well) is just a part of the message and should be handled appropriately (like anywhere else, e. g. when copying messages, creating backups etc.). T‚Ä¶

In combination with this feature, its might save a lot of space without actually deleting the messages. Or atleast if either of these would be helpful.

link_counts.title: Media deletion: Keep message text / don't delete whole message

posts.name: Sandro
posts.cooked:
I‚Äôm using Signal since a few weeks and i configured the backup to a cloud folder of mine. Now i‚Äôve seen that it‚Äôs already 7mb large, which is not large at first view but i did not a lot of chatting in this time, but i‚Äôve send and received a lot of images. Now i assume that images are included in backup, which would blow up that thing over the time.

My suggestion is to implement an option to completly exclude selectable media types from backup (images, videos and so on) or to create an option for like a media retention over a configurable time period. Like: Keep only images and videos that has been sent/received in the last 30 days in backup.

SandroL:

Now i assume that images are included in backup

Yes, as well as videos, gifs, etc., as that would be the expected behavior. Allowing users to customize this behavior could be interesting.

In the meantime, have you looked at the storage manager? I think the idea would be that people who don‚Äôt care enough about their media to want them in backups would delete them manually from time to time anyway, so the backup function wouldn‚Äôt need to be changed.

posts.name: Sandro
posts.cooked:
Hi, yes i had a look at the storage manager, but i‚Äôve not seen an option to set the retention for media types seperatly from text. Or did i miss there something? I‚Äôve expected an option like ‚ÄúKeep only images newer than 30 days‚Äù or something, but it seems it‚Äôs bound to textmessages.

Anyway, in my scenario and i guess in the most scenarios the physical space on my phone is much larger that the cloudspace where i upload my backups, so a media filter for backups would make there sense. I like to keep my pictures etc. on my phone as long as there is enough space, but it would be ok for me that in restore case i would lose and media that‚Äôs older than for example 30 days.

posts.name: Abdul
posts.cooked: This is a huge pain point for me. My backup are occupying 10s of GBs. I would just want to backup text and maybe images but not videos.
